questions.question: The boys rotated positions after every out.  What does that tell you about the kid's game?

choices.answer: The kids made up their own rules.
The narrator was an expert at the game.
The kids were good at taking turns.
The narrator didn't like being in the outfield.

questions.question: Matias, Juan and Cota were considered "the law".  What does that mean?

choices.answer: They had relatives on the police force.

questions.question: You can tell that "Baseball" is a narrative essay because

choices.answer: it explains the game of baseball in detail.
the story is about real events and real people.
it reports events from the past.

questions.question: According to "Baseball" which of the following is NOT true about first base?

choices.answer: First base was to the right of the batter.
First base was behind the pitcher.
First base was wherever the stone landed after being thrown.

questions.question: A player who caught the ball on the fly would
In "Baseball" what made the setting of the game so enjoyable for the author?

choices.answer: It was so similar to a real baseball field.
It allowed players to run far.
It was close to his home.

questions.question: How did the boys get the baseball for their game?

choices.answer: They found it in the street.
They saved up to buy it.
They received it as a gift.
It belonged to the author's father.

questions.question: Uncle Adolfo walked away "marveling at our ignorance." What does that mean?

choices.answer: He was amazed by their lack of knowledge of the game.
The kids are not very smart.
He was jealous of the fun they were having.
He was going to teach the kids the official baseball rules.

questions.question: What does it mean when Uncle Adolfo says, "What a waste of a good ball"?

choices.answer: The kids wanted to save the ball rather than use it.
The kids didn't use the ball the way he thought they should.

questions.question: Which of the following does NOT support the main idea of "Baseball"?

choices.answer: The boys could run anywhere to get to first base.
Father Zavala would watch and laugh with joy.
Uncle Adolfo played for the major leagues.
The boys could peg each other with the ball to make an out.

questions.question: What kind of organization is used in "Forest Fire"?
In "Forest Fire," the fire spread so quickly down the mountain because

choices.answer: the fast-moving hot winds intensified it.
the fire hydrants ran out of water.
the fire-fighters couldn't get their hoses up the mountain.
the towns didn't evacuate quick enough.

questions.question: Why did Nin choose to pack the diaries?

choices.answer: She didn't have time to pack anything else.
Her neighbors asked her to pack them.
They had sentimental value to her.
The diaries contained important evacuation instructions.

questions.question: What word best describes the reporter's attitude toward Nin when she saves only her diaries?
Nin helps during the evacuation by

choices.answer: making coffee and answering phone calls.

questions.question: Following the fire, Nin's town experiences

choices.answer: spoiled crops and a lack of vegetation.

questions.question: The fearful animals that are driven down the mountainside by the fire

choices.answer: are herded onto a nearby farm.
choose to run back into the fire.
are guided to safety by rangers.

questions.question: What device? "I saw trees become skeletons..."
What device? "hundreds of roofs burst into flames at once."
What device? "throwing spirals of smoke in the air like the smoke from a volcano."
Which two words does Nin use to describe nature at the end of the selection?
